item.title: Installing Node.js on Ubuntu 10.04 server
item.author: jason@jjasonclark.com (Jason Clark)
item.description: Most of the guides I find on how to install [Node.js][1] on Ubuntu are not about installing the currently released version, instead they focus on installing the latest development release. I think this is the case because they assume the reader is familiar with doing software installs on unix from source. I'm coming from a Windows word were installing from the source is almost never done. This guide is for someone relatively new to unix installation or to Ubuntu server setup.
